definition: To produce a change in something; in psychology, a person's observable emotion.
examples: Lack of sleep can affect your mood.
The medicine did not affect the results.

extra.memory_tip: Affect = A for Action (a verb) that changes things.

definition: To work out an answer using numbers or careful thinking.
examples: Calculate the area of the rectangle.
She calculated how long the trip would take.

definition: The usual weather of a place over a long time; the general mood or situation.
examples: The desert has a hot, dry climate.
The school has a friendly climate for learning.

extra.memory_tip: Climate = long-time weather ‘climb’ of a place.

definition: A tall post that supports a building; a vertical list of numbers or words.
examples: Stone columns held up the roof.
Add the numbers in the second column.

extra.memory_tip: Column = stands up tall like a pillar or a vertical list.

definition: The slow rotting or breaking down of something; to rot or break down over time.
examples: Tooth decay can be prevented by brushing. (noun)
Leaves decay and become soil. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Decay = things ‘go away’ bit by bit.

definition: To be more than a number, limit, or expectation.
examples: Do not exceed the speed limit.
Her results exceeded expectations.

definition: To order someone not to do something; to make something not allowed.
examples: The sign forbids swimming here.
Parents forbid screens after bedtime.

extra.memory_tip: Forbid = before it’s done, you bid ‘no’.

examples: We ate lunch in a shady grove.
An orange grove stretched across the valley.

definition: An arm or leg of a person or animal; a large branch of a tree.
examples: The bird tucked its injured limb.
A heavy limb fell during the storm.

extra.memory_tip: Limb = living branch—on bodies or trees.

definition: A large, hairy, extinct elephant-like animal; very large.
examples: Scientists found a frozen mammoth. (noun)
They faced a mammoth task. (adjective)

extra.memory_tip: Mammoth = massive like the ancient beast.

definition: Fully grown or developed; to become fully grown or developed.
examples: A mature tree gives deep shade. (adjective)
Cheese matures for months before sale. (verb)

definition: To allow something; an official paper that says you may do something.
examples: The park permits dogs on leads. (verb)
We applied for a parking permit. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Permit = permission in action or on paper.

definition: To fight against something or try not to be affected by it.
examples: It’s hard to resist fresh cookies.
Plants resist disease with strong defences.

extra.memory_tip: Resist = stand firm and ‘resist the twist’.

definition: To burn the surface of something; a mark caused by burning or intense heat.
examples: The sun scorched the grass in summer. (verb)
The pan had a brown scorch on the bottom. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Scorch = scorch marks from strong heat.

definition: A tall, narrow building; to rise very high above something.
examples: The castle had a watch tower. (noun)
Snowy peaks tower over the village. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Tower = tall and towering above all.
